intro: Coupoui micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered cupuaçu, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon basin. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit, which resembles a large bean, contains a viscous, aromatic pulp used in traditional medicine and food. The botanical features of Coupoui micrantha make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts.
